audio_description: Hello everyone! Welcome back to another video. I'm Priscila Benjamin. When it comes to biryani, almost every region has its own variety. Today, I'm sharing a Kerala special — Thalassery Biryani. The taste is incredible, so let’s get started and check out the recipe!

audio_description: For this recipe, I’ve taken 2 glasses of Jeerakasala rice, also known as Kaima rice. Wash and soak it for 10 minutes. I’ve also taken 1 kg of chicken. For better flavor, I’m going to marinate the chicken. To that, add some salt.

audio_description: Add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp chilli powder, 1 tsp pepper powder, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, and 2 tbsp curd. Mix it all together and let it rest for 30 minutes.

audio_description: Next, for frying — in a pan, add 1 tsp ghee and 4 tbsp oil. Once it heats up, add thinly sliced onions and fry them until light golden brown. Once fried, remove and set aside. In the same oil, fry cashew nuts and raisins.

audio_description: Once they are golden and puffed, remove and set aside. In a pot, add 4 glasses of water — for 2 glasses of rice. Add whole spices like bay leaf, cloves, and cardamom, plus salt and ½ tsp ghee. Let it come to a boil.

audio_description: Once the water starts boiling, add the soaked rice. Mix, cover with a lid, and cook. Once the rice is done, set it aside. Now let’s prepare the chicken masala. In a kadai, add 3 tsp ghee.

audio_description: Once hot, add whole spices — a small piece of cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaf, star anise, and cloves. Sauté for a few minutes. Add 3 thinly sliced onions and salt. Sauté until they turn light brown.

audio_description: Add ¼ tsp nutmeg powder, ½ tsp pepper powder, 1½ tsp chicken masala, and 1 tsp biryani masala. Sauté until the raw smell disappears. Then, add 2 sliced tomatoes and mix well.

audio_description: Top with the remaining rice. Sprinkle some garam masala and fried onions.

audio_description: Add cashew nuts, coriander, and mint leaves. Finally, drizzle a few drops of ghee. Cover the pot with aluminum foil. If you don’t have foil, seal the pot using wheat flour or maida dough. Dum it for 10 minutes.

audio_description: After 10 minutes, open the pot — and there you go! Delicious Thalassery Biryani is ready to serve. The taste is incredible and it’s a must-try! If you liked this recipe, like and share it. And if you haven’t subscribed yet, consider subscribing. See you in the next video. Until then, take care and bye!
